section.title: Basic Exponents

introduction.p: Yay! We will now look at basic exponents! Let's dive right in!

solution.p: We are multiplying 3 by itself 3 times. We can write that as 3^3.

statement.p: Write x \times x \times x as an exponent.

solution.p: Similar to the previous example, we are multiplying x times itself 3 times and we would write it as x^3.
We are multiplying x by itself 1 time to get just x. We can write this as x^1.

section.p: Let's do a few exercises. You should really try to understand the solutions for these, as you will need these skills next lesson. Have fun!

statement.p: Write y \times y \times y \times y as an exponent.

solution.p: We are multiplying y by itself 4 times, to get y^4.

statement.p: Write the expression x \times x \times x \times x \times x as an exponent.

solution.p: We are multiplying 4 by itself 3 times, so we write 4^3, and we are multplying that by x. Thus, we can write 4^3x.

statement.p: Write 5 \times x \times x \times x \times y \times y as an exponent.

solution.p: We are multiplying x by itself 3 times and y by itself 2 times. We can write those as x^3 and y^2. Since we are multiplying all of those together, we can write it as 5x^3y^2.

section.p: That's all for this lesson! We'll continue with multiplying exponents in the next lesson!
